wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement News Roundup 11/06/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top employee engagement articles from around the industry to keep you informed and inspire positive impact in your organization.

One Downside of an Up Economy: Employee Turnover

A recent Deloitte survey found that culture and engagement’critical factors in employee retention’are the number one challenge organizations are facing. As the economy continues to improve, employment opportunities are becoming more abundant, which means current employers are scrambling to find new ways to retain top talent. This article shares best practices and ideas for creating a company culture that employees won’t want to walk away from.

Why You Must Make Culture the Centerpiece of Your Onboarding Program

Not only does a new hire need to be the right fit for a position, they need to fit culturally to the organization. Poor fit with organizational culture is the #1 reason for new hire departure, so how can organizations help them assimilate? The answer lies in the onboarding process during the critical 0-90 days upon starting. CEO of JAMF Software, Dean Hager, says, Culture is your only sustainable competitive advantage. Hager explains that every employee hired goes through their onboarding program which is positioned around three key areas: culture, role, and product. While the investment is huge, the impact is even greater. Since implementing their onboarding program, they have seen a 90% increase in retention for employees and 95% for customers.

The Top 5 CSR, Sustainability and Employee Engagement Reports of 2015 ‘ And Why They’re Important

Our very own CEO, Susan Hunt Stevens, talks about the critical role employee engagement, corporate social responsibility (CSR), and sustainability play in the overall success of an organization. She explains the top five most compelling reports from this year and provides insights into companies that are already committed to these initiatives. As more employees seek purposeful work, the importance of adopting this business for good, good for business approach becomes all the more relevant and impactful.

How Generation Z Will Make CSR A Business Norm

Generation Z, the first generation born in the 21st century’ages 2 to 19’currently represents about 25% of the U.S. population and accounts for over 44 billion in buying power annually. The author explains, Generation Z views corporate social responsibility as a core brand identifier for products and businesses. This generation questions more, demands more, and aren’t afraid to expose companies who aren’t fully committed to CSR. The article explains that now companies are at the mercy of Generation Z, they have two options: sink or swim.

HR Technology For 2016: Ten Disruptions On The Horizon

Josh Bersin, author of Deloitte’s “Ten Big Disruptions” in HR report, believes that appification has arrived. There is already a lot of trending data that show that apps are the future of HR and some of the top trends for 2016 include the rising market for feedback, culture, and engagement apps and the maturity of employee well-being, wellness and productivity systems. The main theme across all trends is that exciting HR applications are being built as apps first, and web systems later, making them more accessible and easier to navigate.
